Key Match Events: Corey Seager took a mighty swing and barely connected, sending a squibber through an open area on the left side of the infield for his team’s first hit in the seventh inning.
Marcus Semien homered in a four-run ninth and the Rangers finished off baseball’s third all-wild card World Series by outlasting Arizona in a white-knuckle pitchers’ duel.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy, manager of the Texas Rangers, won his fourth World Series title 13 years to the day after his first, which came in 2010 when the Giants beat the Rangers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers won the first World Series championship in their 63-season franchise history by beating the Arizona Diamondbacks 5-0 in Game 5.
Others: Nathan Eovaldi pitched six gritty innings, Mitch Garver broke a scoreless tie with an RBI single in the seventh, and the Rangers won the first World Series championship in their 63-season franchise history by beating the Arizona Diamondbacks 5-0 in Game 5.
